title: ICE on tuple struct pattern

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
use std::ffi::OsStr;
use std::path::Component;

pub fn panic_with_msgbox<'a, I: Iterator<Item = Component<'a>>>(a: I) -> bool {
    a.any(|c| match c {
        Component::Normal(OsStr::new("src")) => true,
//        Component::Normal(&OsStr::new("src")) => true,
        _ => false,
    })
}
```

```

  --> src/lib.rs:14:45

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib
```

---

This one is very interesting IMHO.
The "original" ICE was introduced between 056f589fb...4b9b70c39, **but** if I prepend the `&` before `OsStr` (the outcommented line), there's a second ICE that is there forever (at least since Rust 1.11).

@rustbot modify labels: I-ICE C-bug
